attributes.action: Allow the public to vote on the legalisation of Cannabis for recreational use.
attributes.background: It's about time that the British public are given the freedom to vote on the legalisation of Cannabis. Many other countries have already done so and have seen benefits from this.
attributes.additional_details: Take the criminal side of Cannabis and put it in the past where it belongs. Free up funding and time for the police which is wasted on chasing and prosecuting people for the use of a natural non toxic substance. Regulate and tax the market.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318654

attributes.action: End child hunger
attributes.background:
End UK child hunger within the lifetime of this current parliament.
By changing government policies that directly result in child hunger. Primarily, these are free school meals and universal credit policies.
attributes.additional_details:
There are millions of people in the UK who are below the food poverty line and of the total,about 3 million schoolkids regularly go without food. It is now well understood that hunger directly leads to poor physical and mental health issues. Continuing malnutrition also ensures that these children are doomed to underperform at all levels versus their well fed peers.  
If we help the children first, we should naturally be encouraged to continue the fight to end all food poverty.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

End child food poverty – no child should be going hungry: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554276

Take action to address the rising levels of child poverty: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552744

If you want the Government to take other actions not covered by the above petition you could start a new petition requesting these, but it would need to be clear what specific changes you want the Government.

attributes.action: Debate the catastrophic numbers of hedgehogs in road traffic accidents in the UK
attributes.background: Investigate the potential possibility of building wildlife highways to save our hedgehog and other wildlife population's dwindling numbers due to high levels of traffic. Also to explain our never ending thirst for concreting over our countries green spaces.
attributes.additional_details:
By mans never ending over-development of our countryside, we are unbalancing our fragile ecosystem and causing irreversible damage to our environment. 

This is all in the pursuit of man's greed and obsession with material wealth instead of sharing a wealth of our country's natural beauty.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550379

attributes.action: Enoble Archbishop Sentamu to be a member of the House of Lords
attributes.background: To respect the enormous contribution Archbishop Sentamu has made in British society as the first black Archbishop of York by debating and voting in favour of enobling him into the House of Lords.
attributes.additional_details:
This will be acknowledgement of his contribution and valuing of the nature of how he is held in high esteem and a role model for the BAME community and proponents of an anti-racist society. 
He still has a lot to offer in the legislative process through his lived experiences in his previous judiciary and religious roles.

rejection.details:
We can't publish petitions about honours or appointments. That includes calling for people to be appointed to the House of Lords.

You can find out how members of the House or Lords are appointed here: https://www.parliament.uk/business/lords/whos-in-the-house-of-lords/members-and-their-roles/how-members-are-appointed/

attributes.action: Create the worlds largest solar farm in the UK instead of building Disney Land.
attributes.background: I want the government to listen to David Attenborough and realise he has spent his whole life watching and speaking out about how us as humans are slowly ending the world as we know it. We need to act now and plant trees all over this country and ban Carbon emissions And learn to rebuild nature.
attributes.additional_details: There will be no government or parliament if we carry on. It will be the end of humanity and it’s not fair to our wildlife and us humans, we need to wake up! We have the tools, the knowledge and the power to act now. We have no excuse for how we go about our lives. This world is just as much belonging to wildlife as it is to us, we are all one. Each strand of grass and each leaf on every tree should matter, if we don’t act we won’t be able to reverse the fires Coming.

rejection.details: The Government is not responsible for Disneyland. We could accept a petition calling on the Government to increase funding for renewable energy, including solar, if that is what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Do a full environmental impact assessment of HS2
attributes.background: Stop immediately the destruction of trees on the route of HS2.  It makes no sense to be trying to plant trees to prevent global warming and and at the same time to destroy ancient forests which are over 400 years old.  Since Covid the need for commuting has decreased.
attributes.additional_details: We need more time to assess whether the impact of the trees destroyed will have a serious adverse effect on the carbon levels in our environment.  A measurement of the loss of carbon absorption caused by woodland destruction needs to be made.  New trees are small and do not always survive.  The need for commuter transport is dropping.  Home working has increased and has been found to be very efficient for business.  During the Covid lockdown, naure walks have been vital in maintaining well being for people.  Many natural habitats will be lost if HS2 goes ahead.  By the time it HS2 can be built, it will probably not be needed.  Woodland ecosystems will be destroyed which can never be replaced.  We do not have the right to cause such devastation to the natural world.

rejection.details:
Environmental statements have already been published for each stage of HS2:

Phase One: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/hs2-phase-one-environmental-statement-documents

Phase 2a: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/hs2-phase-2a-environmental-statement

Phase 2b: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/hs2-phase-2b-working-draft-environmental-statement

It's not clear what further information you want to be published.

We have already published a number of petitions about HS2, some of which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&q=hs2

attributes.action: Repeal the Greater Manchester Spatial Framework (in all of forms).
attributes.background: We would like the national Government to step in and prevent the local Councils of Greater Manchester from developing on green belt land.
attributes.additional_details: The green belt of Greater Manchester is vitally important to all local residents. Developing on this land would have a huge impact on the local flora and fauna, and the negatives affects on the health and wellbeing of local residents far outweigh the need for additional homes. Greater Manchester has an abundance of brownfield sites that can be utilised to help with the housing crisis without damaging our natural habitats and environment.

rejection.details:
Deciding on local planning policies is a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to ban all development on the green belt, to prevent local authorities from authorising development in these areas.

attributes.action: Change school uniform policy to help Environment, Industry, and Agriculture
attributes.background:
Introduce a school uniform scheme where uniforms are made from natural wool fleece products that are subsidised/rented to parents.
Give farmers a fair price for fleece.
Provide jobs in manufacturing for old mill towns.
Save the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
To support 
British Industry 
British Agriculture
Parents of school children
The Environment
Reduce, slave labour products, environmental miles and school heating bills

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for school uniforms. It is up to  the governing body of a school to decide whether there should be a school
uniform policy and if so what that should be, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Cancel the switch to daylight savings time
attributes.background: I believe there should be only one universal time. That means no daylight savings switch in autumn and back to summer time in spring.
attributes.additional_details: It is difficult to transition to another time every year, it affects the sleeping patterns and even mental health of some. The days get way shorter and it gets dark very quick, which also takes a negative toll in mental health. Even though days get naturally shorter in winter time, it would be more comfortable to just have the same time frame throughout the year.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300931

attributes.action: Ban all imports of wood and meat from Brazil into the United Kingdom
attributes.background: To save the Amazon rain forests and subsequently the World
attributes.additional_details: We all need to do more to save our planet; stopping imports of wood and meat from Brazil will show to the world our Government's true attitude and determination to help the natural environment to recover.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327422.

attributes.action: Longer sentence for crimes involving abuse of children and legalise cannabis use
attributes.background: We want the government to make sentencing harsher/longer for people who commit and are involved with grooming children, child abuse and any type of paedophilia and also want the government to legalise the use of cannabis for health conditions, in a person's own property and in certain venues.
attributes.additional_details: When a person involved in any sort of abuse to children the justice system always disappoints when It comes to sentencing the person involved, the public have noticed other crimes have longer sentences e.g growing a small amount of cannabis, how can cannabis a plant that grows naturally harm people worse than a paedophile harms a child? This is why we want cannabis to be legalised in the UK and for any person involved with child abuse to get a longer and harsher sentence.

rejection.details:
We think that these petitions are similar:

Longer sentences for child sex offenders, sex offenders and rapists
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323338

Make cannabis legal for recreational use for ages 21+
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300201

Legalise Cannabis for recreational and medicinal purposes
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300475

attributes.action: Stop weigh-ins for school children
attributes.background: Weigh-ins are damaging, unhelpful, traumatising, encourage fat shaming & create damaging relationships with food eg. eating disorders.  Weight is not a reliable health indicator. Better alternatives include increasing healthy lifestyle education (physical & mental health, nutrition etc).
attributes.additional_details: A weight loss focus encourages restrictive eating, binge eating, excessive exercise & calorie counting. Millions of UK citizens suffer from eating disorders (EDs). Weigh-ins would likely increase severity & number of pupils with EDs. Weighing children would encourage bullying & be unreliable (weight naturally increases with height). Instead, teach healthy relationships with exercise, food, drink & educate about links between mental & physical health, promote healthy canteen & lifestyle options.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548219

attributes.action: Stop the planning reform!
attributes.background: Boris Johnson's planning reform must not happen and needs to be stopped. Local residents need a say into what happens with their countryside!
attributes.additional_details: This reform is an attack on local democracy. It lets cash greedy house builders destroy our green land whilst giving local residents no say whatsoever. It will alow the slums of the future to be built on Britains beautiful green fields with no respect for nature. Let the people decide not the goverment and rich house builders!

rejection.details:
The UK Government have made and proposed lots of different changes to the planning system recently. We understand that you're concerned about planning, but we're not sure what particular reforms you're concerned about. 

You could start a new petition that clearly explains what you'd like to happen. For example, you could start a new petition asking the Government to ensure that planning permission is needed to expand a building, by adding more height or floor space, or change it's use, from an office to flats for example. 

You can find out more about changes to the planning system here: 

https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/sn00485/
https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-8981/

We have a few petitions about planning that you might like to sign and share:

Remove the Planning Inspectorate's power to override elected councils
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319314

Ban new housing developments in National Parks
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333111

Make it law for all new builds to include green energy solutions.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332338

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Stop funding the BBC with the TV License fee or other public money.
attributes.background: Television has evolved over the last 20 years, with many forms of media now available. Many citizens do not want to watch BBC programs, yet they are forced to fund the BBC via the TV License. We understand that the TV license funds other things, but we do not want it to fund the BBC any longer.
attributes.additional_details: Please remove the BBC from the list of beneficiaries of the TV license fee. It is not fair to make citizens pay for content they have no intention of watching, this is almost communist/socialist in nature. Regardless of the structure, it amounts to state television. Redirect the funds into the other areas which are funded by the TV license.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331189

attributes.action: Stop the use of horses by the Police.
attributes.background: I would like to see the use of horses by the Police force in the UK to cease.  These animals are vulnerable to being hurt and as has recently be shown, do in fact get hurt.
attributes.additional_details: Horses are prey animals.  In the recent disruptive protests in London horses were either directly or indirectly hurt.  One horse threw it's rider and bolted.  One horse suffered a broken nose.  No matter how much training a horse receives, their natural instinct will be to run when they feel attacked.  They are a prey animal.  They are being exploited to this end, and it seems inappropriate to be using an animal in such frightening circumstances.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban the use of horses in the police force: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325179

Ban the use of horses for crowd control: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325275

attributes.action: Glasgow City Council to rename all streets in Glasgow that glorify slavery
attributes.background: Glasgow needs to publicly account for their shameful participation and profit from the slave trade. By keeping the existing street names such as Buchanan, Virginia etc. we are collectively continuing to honour our deplorable history.
attributes.additional_details: Pressure needs to be applied to the appellate authorities to ensure that the sins of the past are put right in the present. In this day and age it is unacceptable to ignore something as profoundly problematic as this. Many are aware of this, council figures have even publicly commented on the issues’ condemnable nature. However, no tangible action has been taken. It is time to change.

rejection.details:
Decisions about individual historical monuments, statues, plaques and street names are a matter for the local authority in which they are located and private landowners, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you want to raise concerns about a particular historical monument or statue, or request a new monument or statue be erected, you should contact your local authority about this.

The Local Government Association has published an advice note to help councils work to ensure all sections of the community feel heard by decision-makers and each other: https://www.local.gov.uk/topics/community-safety/statues

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Encourage and support the removal of memorials that glorify the slave trade: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325449

Create an advisory board to review public statues and decide on their removal: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325673

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable BBQ's in the countryside and all public outdoor spaces
attributes.background: I'm asking the government to put a ban on the use of disposable BBQ's in all public outdoor spaces. This would include national parks, open moorland, country parks, public beaches and all other public spaces.
attributes.additional_details: Disposable BBQ's not only are the cause of so many accidental fires and scorch marks causing damage to wildlife habitat's and fauna all across he country, they also have a massive part to play in litter pollution when left behind after use. Not only can they not be recycled or composted but also have sharp wire mesh that could injure or kill animals and the foil tray is a natural heat source when left in the suns rays causing a possible fire. Each fire cost thousands in resources to extinguish.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323233

attributes.action: Hold a independent public enquiry into the handling of the covid-19 crisis
attributes.background: To commission a full and independent inquiry into the government's handling of the covid-19 crisis especially in terms of the deaths in care homes. With a view to looking at all aspects of the exit plan and the timing and nature of the lockdown, also the issue of ppe.
attributes.additional_details: Because I feel that the decisions made may well have increased the number of deaths and put at unnecessary risk the well being of the British public.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302576

attributes.action: Show scientific proof that covid-19 is real and 5G is safe
attributes.background: We want the government to show scientific evidence that covid-19 is real and 5G is safe. Too many people are beginning to believe that there are conspiracies hiding the truth. Is the lockdown a costly mistake that will have far bigger consequences for years to come?
attributes.additional_details:
We want the government to show that covid-19 is not being mistaken for exosomes that are part of the bodies natural defence mechanism. Are the pcr tests detecting exosomes instead of covid-19? Are the deaths due to a severe influenza season which happens on a regular basis?
We also want the government to provide scientific test studies into the safety of 5G. Simply saying it's safe is not good enough.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government has already published scientific guidance on 5G:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/5g-technologies-radio-waves-and-health/5g-technologies-radio-waves-and-health

You might like to sign this petition calling for an independent investigation into 5G safety, if that's something you'd like to see happen:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312997

There have been a wide range of studies around the world on the existence and impacts of Covid-19, but you might like to sign this petition calling for the publication of evidence:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332460

attributes.action: Scrap HS2 and use the money to fund the NHS and elderly care
attributes.background: Use the money destined for HS2 to fund the NHS and elderly care.  This money would be better used for these causes which have been underfunded for years. Elderly care is disjointed and unfair on people who have saved their money.  Scrap Phase 2 of HS2 altogether and improve the rail network we have.
attributes.additional_details: By not building Phase 2 of HS2 and using the money for NHS and elderly care would ensure these causes would be adequately funded, the countryside and wildlife would be protected by not destroying woodlands and people would not be forced from their homes to make way for HS2, air quality would be improved and pollution lessened.  The abuse of nature would be less and people would be living in a better environment.  The rail network we have needs improving and this could be done at much less cost.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311642

attributes.action: Debate whether Boris Johnson should receive his salary as 'claps' from now on.
attributes.background: If Boris Johnson thinks it is appropriate for NHS workers to be clapped for the work they have been doing during the Covid-19 pandemic rather than getting fair pay, then presumably he wouldn't mind getting paid in claps also.
attributes.additional_details: The only background necessary to understand is the continued refusal of the Conservative government to pay NHS staff in accordance with the context in UK 2020 meaning, living costs, the nature of the work and importantly the additional work they have had to face during the pandemic.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:
http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/

You might like to sign and share this petition instead:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313513

attributes.action: Change the rape law to recognise female perpetrators.
attributes.background: I want the current definition of rape to be changed so that female perpetrators can be legally recognised. Female-on-male non-consensual sex should be recognised as rape and not sexual assault or a s4 offence. The gendered definition is unjust and the justifications given previously, unsatisfactory.
attributes.additional_details: Male victims of non-consensual sex by female perpetrators are under protected by the law due to the condition of penile penetration by the perpetrator. Females can coerce/force men into non-consensual sex. If the gender roles were reversed, this would be rape yet this serious sexual violation is not recognised as such, simply due to the nature of the victim. Further, as the wrong is in the violation of sexual autonomy or the deception under the s76 presumptions, then gender should be irrelevant.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300270

attributes.action: Reduce the Royals!
attributes.background: Change the royals currently working and representing our country. We only have 4 working royals under 60! The likes of the Kents don't even descend from Elizabeth II. They've served their country and had their time, but get the York Princesses to represent us since they're in their 30s.
attributes.additional_details: The royal family is one of the greatest things Britian has. Changing it to be the descendants of HM The Queen rather than George V (who died early 1936) is just natural. Instead of Princess Alexandra, The Dukes & Duchesses of Gloucester and Kent, we can have Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie as well as the children of The Earl and Countess of Wessex; Louise and James. The Wessex children in particular have shown to be very close to the Queen.

rejection.details: This would be a decision for the Royal Family, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Stop the 5G rollout until independent testing proves it universally safe
attributes.background: For the government to stop the use and rollout of all 5G technology and the 5G radio wave spectrum until independent peer-reviewed long-termed research has been conducted that assures it is safe to humans, wildlife and environmental health.
attributes.additional_details: To provide an independent peer-reviewed, unbiased evidence base on the health consequences from long-term exposure for humans, wildlife or the natural environment. The government must stop this rollout until the long-term effects have been assessed for humans, and all fauna and flora.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312997

attributes.action: No return to 'Business as usual' after COVID 19 restrictions lifted.
attributes.background: This has shown that people can accomodate huge changes in short spaces of time.  This opportunity should be used to bring the country together going forward, in embracing a new, healthier, fairer, significantly more environmentally conscious future, instead of returning to the ratrace of normality.
attributes.additional_details:
People want major changes after lockdown ends. Pollution has gone down, energy consumption has gone down, nature is recovering. People are buying more locally produced food items. People are appreciating the work of proffessions that have long gone unrecognised or considered menial(nurses, teachers, shop staff). People are walking & cycling more, and in some ways are now connecting (virtually) more with friends and family all over the world. 
We want to continue down this less destructive path.

rejection.details:
We understand that you don't want to see a return to business as usual after the lockdown, but it's not clear what action you want the Governmetn to take.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Require suitable businesses offer remote & flexible working to employees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

Study impact of home working on health & the environment and act on the results: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317466

Rebuild the economy out of lockdown with a Green New Deal: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Keep Schools Closed/Voluntary Attendance prevent Parents dying of Covid-19.
attributes.background: VOLUNTARILY SCHOOL ATTENDANCE CHOICE during this pandemic. Parents should be given choice whether they want to the risk with their lives, do not play Russian roulette with our lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Schools are breeding grounds for respiratory illnesses. Kids are very good vectors of these viruses,because they are touching and curious just by nature. Social Distancing will not work at school at all/not repeatedly wash hands thoroughly. 

They will bring the infection home to parents, some will be sick/die. 

Some parents want to support their parents (Grandparents), however then will be further restricted, since children going to School.

No prosecution for parents that remove child from school during a pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300399

attributes.action: Let people engage in any outdoor activity if they can maintain social distancing
attributes.background: Expand the permission to leave home for exercise to let people engage in birdwatching, fishing, sunbathing, or any outdoor activity, if social distancing can be maintained.
attributes.additional_details:
The purpose of the lockdown is to prevent transmission of the virus. The government has no justification to prevent activities which pose very low risk of transmission. Now more than ever, people need to be able to enjoy nature.

Please stop setting policy for the whole country based on overcrowded London parks. The rest of Britain has plenty of space and should be allowed to use it.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has eased the lockdown restrictions, including allowing people to spend more time outside. You can read the current guidance on what you can and can't do here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

attributes.action: Allow private fisheries to open during covid-19  providing they Social distance
attributes.background:
Allow private fisheries to open for Angler’s allowing them to fish   Maximum party of two persons and within a certain distance from their home address  
Paying fee’s online and keeping social distancing rules
attributes.additional_details:
Fishing is proven to be effective at combatting mental health   A recent report showed a 30% improvement in the mental health of ptsd sufferers  
It’s a naturally isolated pastime   With Angler’s using their own equipment and seating   
It’s also physically healthy  when catching a fish as well as casting the rod  Private fisheries already have good bio security and all lakes and pools have a distance greater than 2 metres apart between Angler’s. 
 This would not allow matches though

attributes.action: Abolish daylight saving in UK. Maintain GMT all year.
attributes.background: Changing the clocks makes people sad, angry and depressed. We don't need that in our lives right now. It's an historical practice which bears no benefit to current society.
attributes.additional_details:
Stopping this practice would make people more productive, much less likely to self harm and able to adapt to the natural rhythm of the seasons.

Please stop time, stop summer time.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300931

attributes.action: Safeguard recovering wildlife now: create a positive Coronavirus Legacy
attributes.background: Globally Covid-19 lockdowns have had unexpected benefits for emerging and recovering wildlife. The UK Gov must act now to create new situation-relevant and proactive safeguarding measures and laws specific to ensuring a return to business as usual mitigates damage to habitats, marine and wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned, request the UK Gov act now to baseline, create action plans and implement new laws and safeguarding measures to protect areas where nature is recovering or has potential to thrive in future due to a decline in human activity. Balance human, industrial and economic recovery with natural recovery, re-wilding and replenishing.  We ask the UK Government to include recovering species protection in its forward-planning to create a positive, world-leading green Coronavirus legacy.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Grant all workers tax exemption on their overtime pay earned during the outbreak
attributes.background: Many people, especially in the NHS, are taking on extra hours and working extra shifts in order to maintain services and treat the significan increase in victims of the Corvid-19 virus outbreak.
attributes.additional_details:
It would be a recognition of the commitment shown, not only during this crisis but continuing all year 'round, by the staff of all our emergency services, front line and support staff within the NHS in particular.
Due to the nature of the work NHS staff cannot simply 'work from home' as many are doing, instead they have to work in areas that are potential infection hotspots

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for setting the salary of most key workers, or setting minimum wages for particular sectors, but you may wish to sign petitions calling for the following actions:

Make hazard pay mandatory for key workers in the midst of COVID 19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307619

Give all key workers a 100% tax and Nat. Ins. holiday through COVID-19 crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306845

Pay bonus to all key workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307215

Incentivise NHS staff during the COVID19 outbreak by making wages untaxable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304595

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073

Bonus for emergency services personnel working due to COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303306

Make the minimum wage equal for all ages and increase to at least £10: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301749

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: For Environmental awareness to be made compulsory and a module within Schools
attributes.background: For all schools to apply a core module from early years on the Environment encouraging awareness and action. It can be a fundamental initiative which encourages young people to engage in their environment by being educated on climate change fit for each school year.
attributes.additional_details: Environmental education is essential to ensure our future generations apply the measures required to preserve our environment. Bringing nature to the classroom is imperative to highlight to school children (and parents indirectly) the need for change. Environmental awareness and nature should be on a par with key classes in all schools. It is essential that children grow up with a great understanding, education in current issues and knowledge on what actions to take to protect earth.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300279

attributes.action: Close all Schools, Colleges and Work as a result of Coronavirus
attributes.background:
The UK government should call for an immediate shutdown of Schools, Colleges and places of work. It will only keep on spreading if we are continuing to have contact with people.

More deaths will increase, as a result as people are not isolating. So, far there has been 8 deaths and 382 cases alone
attributes.additional_details: Public health should come first over anything whether it’s the economy. Everyone, should not have wages reduced. In China alone there has been 80,790 cases and 3,158 deaths. It is increasing all around the world. The only way of stopping this virus is not through medicine like antibiotics as thats only for bacteria, but to stay at home until it naturally disappears. It is becoming a global epidemic. If one student was ill then pass on to the rest of class who would then spread & go home pass on.
